Create a Discovery IP range

You can select between different methods for defining the network or network segment for a Discovery schedule to use.
Note: The recommended method for defining IP ranges is to use quick ranges in the Discovery Schedule form.
  1. Select one of these methods from the Type field to define the segment you want Discovery to query:
    • IP Address List: Add individual addresses in the Discovery Range Item IPs related list. These addresses should not be included in any existing IP range or IP network.
    • IP Address Range: You can define arbitrary ranges of IP addresses, which is a good way to include selected segments of a network or subnet. The best practice is to include only those IP addresses in your range that are reserved for manageable devices on the public network. Enter an Ending IP and a Starting IP.
    • IP Network: Specify an IP network of available IP addresses, including the network address (the lowest address in the range) and the broadcast address (the highest address in the range). You must enter the Network mask and the Network IP (the network address).

    The system displays the IP ranges you create in the Summary field of the form, using the appropriate notation.

  2. Add other types as needed.
  3. Specify any IP range items you want to exclude from your queries in the Discovery Range Item Excludes related list.
